intro: Liabum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed liabum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Liabum longipes is typically found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
